CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A12 reads: "Well Dressed - Winning cups for being among Pittsburgh's well-dressed women at the D.I.'s Easter Sunday affair at the New Nixon, were there charmers. Left to right: Pauline Stotts, Gladys Robinson, Phyllis Pitts, Jayne Moore, Catherine Greene, Sue Corsey and Birdie Dunlap.  Left, rear, Johnny Johnson who presented loving cups to the seven fetching matrons. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seven women, from left: Pauline Stotts, Gladys Robinson, Phyllis Pitts, Jayne Moore, Catherine Greene, Sue Corsey and Birdie Dunlap, standing in interior of the New Nixon  for the D.I.'s "Breath of Spring", Johnny Johnson of The Courier standing at microphone in background
